posts.post_content:
Somehow I like him. Good name, awesome art. The abilities actually fit well. He can trample over small creatures, killing them, dealing trample damage to the opponent, gaining you life AND dealing damage with his special ability to the opponent.  
With [grand melee](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=grand melee) he could be fun too.

Posted By: majinara (11/5/2010 11:13:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @ Dr.Pingas: That system of evaluating a card's mana cost didn't work fifteen years ago, and it doesn't now. Expensive creatures can afford to have more abilities and power for their mana cost, as they tend to be much less efficient then the removal your opponents have. Furthermore, they're coming into play against a battlefield that has had time to be populated; most fatties need to address concerns like being chump-blocked and making an immediate impact on the board, lest they simply don't have any impact depsite their size and expense.
posts.html:
@ Dr.Pingas: That system of evaluating a card's mana cost didn't work fifteen years ago, and it doesn't now. Expensive creatures can afford to have more abilities and power for their mana cost, as they tend to be much less efficient then the removal your opponents have. Furthermore, they're coming into play against a battlefield that has had time to be populated; most fatties need to address concerns like being chump-blocked and making an immediate impact on the board, lest they simply don't have any impact depsite their size and expense.
